Articles.Content:
the one on the left is DAE. the right Is FBX. I had no clue there was such a huge difference. What do you guys export as and why? Trying to get better at cleaning up after my boolians.

 

 

Edited August 10, 2017 by harrisjosh2711

On my side i'm using blender and export directly in .blend, because if i update my blender model it will automatically update the Unity scene and keep all the already done work.
there is some parameters to ajust by selecting your model in the Unity asset folder ( specially the: import or not the normals)

7 hours ago, Skalou said:

On my side i'm using blender and export directly in .blend, because if i update my blender model it will automatically update the Unity scene and keep all the already done work.
there is some parameters to ajust by selecting your model in the Unity asset folder ( specially the: import or not the normals)

I'm going to have to give that .blend a try that really is a good idea.
I think that .blend's work pretty well, as I didn't even have to specify rotation of the part in the config.

4 hours ago, Bottle Rocketeer 500 said:

I think that .blend's work pretty well, as I didn't even have to specify rotation of the part in the config.

You can also just rotate the object in unity, interesting though..........
